intro: Trigonella persica, commonly known as Persian trigonella, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits. Trigonella persica is also valued as a forage crop and for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
